'''Turtwig''' ([[List of Japanese Pokémon names|Japanese]]: '''ナエトル''' ''Naetle'') is a {{type|Grass}} {{OBP|Pokémon|species}} introduced in [[Generation IV]].

It [[Evolution|evolves]] into {{p|Grotle}} starting at [[level]] 18, which evolves into {{p|Torterra}} starting at [[level]] 32.

Along with {{p|Chimchar}} and {{p|Piplup}}, Turtwig is one of three [[starter Pokémon]] of [[Sinnoh]] available at the beginning of {{game2|Diamond|Pearl|Platinum}}.

==Biology==
Turtwig is a small, light green, quadruped Pokémon resembling a {{wp|turtle}} or {{wp|tortoise}}. Its eyes, feet, and lower jaw are yellow. Its body is covered by a brown shell that is composed of earth. The shell has a thick black stripe and a black rim. On a very healthy Turtwig, the shell should feel moist. A small seedling grows on a brown patch on its head. This seedling will wilt if the Pokémon becomes thirsty. As a plant-based Pokémon, Turtwig usually nourishes itself through photosynthesis. It also drinks water, which hardens its soil-based shell. Due to its status as a starter Pokémon, a wild Turtwig is hard to come by and it is generally found under the ownership of {{pkmn|Trainer}}s.

==In the anime==
[[File:Ash Turtwig.png|thumb|210px|Turtwig in the {{pkmn|anime}}]]
===Major appearances===
====[[Ash's Turtwig]]====
{{Ash}} obtained his {{AP|Turtwig}} in ''[[DP005|Gettin' Twiggy With It!]]''. It eventually evolved into Grotle during ''[[DP100|Aiding the Enemy!]]'', and again into Torterra during ''[[DP166|The Fleeing Tower of Sunyshore!]]''.

====[[Paul's Turtwig]]====
[[Paul]]'s starter Pokémon was a Turtwig, which eventually fully evolved into a {{TP|Paul|Torterra}}. It appeared as a Turtwig in a flashback with Paul in ''[[DP128|A Pyramiding Rage!]]'' where it was watching [[Reggie]] battle [[Pyramid King Brandon|Brandon]].

====Other====
Turtwig debuted in ''[[DP001|Following a Maiden Voyage]]''. It was a starter Pokémon [[Professor Rowan]] was giving out. It had a relaxed nature, ate almost the whole time, and was oblivious to the fight going on between {{p|Chimchar}} and {{TP|Dawn|Piplup}}. However, it appeared to be afraid of Rowan, as seen when he glared at it and it panicked.

[[Gardenia]] owns a Turtwig, which debuted in ''[[DP031|The Grass-Type is Always Greener!]]''. It was used to battle [[Ash's Staravia]] and {{AP|Turtwig}}, and it was able to defeat both of them. Turtwig reappeared in ''[[DP036|A Secret Sphere of Influence!]]'', where it helped protect the {{DL|Timespace orbs|Adamant Orb}}. It was then used in the Gym battle against {{Ash}} in ''[[DP037|The Grass Menagerie]]'', where it once again defeated {{p|Staravia}}, but lost to Ash's Turtwig.

A Turtwig owned by Rowan appeared in [[SS024]].

===Minor appearances===
A Turtwig appeared in ''[[DP004|Dawn of a New Era!]]'', under the ownership of a {{pkmn|Trainer}} at the [[Pokémon Center]].

A Turtwig appeared in ''[[DP126|Classroom Training!]]''. A young boy was using it at the Trainers' School to battle a {{p|Chimchar}}.

A Turtwig appeared in ''[[PK24|Meloetta's Moonlight Serenade]]''.

==In the manga==
[[File:Tru Turtwig.png|thumb|125px|Turtwig in [[Pokémon Adventures]]]]
===In the Pokémon Adventures manga===
{{main|Tru}}
{{adv|Diamond}} owns a Turtwig, which he nicknamed "[[Tru]]" in [[Pokémon Adventures]], which evolved into a {{p|Grotle}} simultaneously with [[Chimler]] ({{adv|Pearl}}'s {{p|Chimchar}}), and [[Platinum's Piplup]] in [[Eterna City]], and then again in [[Veilstone City]] into a {{p|Torterra}} along with Chimler. He first appeared in ''[[PS338|Stagestruck Starly]]''.

===In the Pokémon Diamond and Pearl Adventure! manga===
A Turtwig appeared in a Poké Ball in ''[[DPA01|In Search of the Legendary Pokémon Dialga!!]]'', being one of the options for [[Hareta]] to pick.

Turtwig is {{OBP|Jun|DPA}}'s [[starter Pokémon]] in [[Pokémon Diamond and Pearl Adventure!]]. It was partnered with [[Hareta's Piplup]] to battle [[Mars]]'s {{p|Zubat}} and {{p|Purugly}}. It later appeared as a {{p|Torterra}}, having evolved from {{p|Grotle}} earlier. It first appeared in ''[[DPA03|The Mystery Boy, Jun!!]]''.

[[Gardenia]] also has a Turtwig which was used in the Gym Battle against [[Hareta]]'s {{p|Misdreavus}} in ''[[DPA04|Win with Teamwork!!]]''.

==Other appearances==
Turtwig appears in [[Super Smash Bros. Brawl]] as a trophy.

===Trophy information===
''"A Tiny Leaf Pokémon. Despite its animal appearance, Turtwig actually has vegetation sprouting from its head. The shell on its back is made of soil and hardens when it drinks water. Much like a plant, Turtwig performs photosynthesis, absorbing sunlight and making oxygen. It also relies heavily on water to keep its plant healthy and thus spends a lot of time near lakes. Turtwig evolves into Grotle."''

==Trivia==
* Turtwig is the heaviest of the basic forms of all of the [[starter Pokémon]]. It also has the lowest base {{stat|Speed}} stat out of all starter Pokémon.
* Turtwig is the only starter Pokémon to know {{m|Withdraw|a stat-raising move}} when initially received as a player's first Pokémon.

===Origin===
{{Bulbanews|On the Origin of Species: Turtwig, Grotle and Torterra}}
Turtwig is based on a {{wp|Chelydridae|snapping turtle}} with plant characteristics.

====Name origin====
Turtwig is a combination of ''{{wp|turtle}}'' and ''twig''.

Naetle is a combination of 苗 ''nae'' ({{wp|Sprouting|sprout}}) and ''turtle''.
